speaker: grahampaige
content: Welcome everyone. Let's begin discussion on: Agenda Item No. 3.3: Technology Plan - The board will review a proposal to expand digital learning access by providing Chromebooks to every high school student. This initiative is estimated to cost $10,000 annually for devices, maintenance, and licensing. The program is designed to ensure equitable access to technology, support blended learning, and prepare students with digital skills for college and career readiness.. Who would like to start?

speaker: jonnoalcaro
content: I'd be happy to kick off our consideration today. As we've discussed before, it seems clear that having one-to-one device availability at all levels can help bridge gaps between those who have reliable home internet connections and others without them. We need more equity across schools as well. So my question here is about how these costs are going to break down over time because if you look closely there may not actually even really be any savings from what they're doing right now since some kids already bring their own laptops but then again maybe other people don't know where else money could come from so let me hear your thoughts first please. Thank you very much. And thank you Mr. Page for bringing us up to speed once again. It was good seeing him last week too. Thanks! (pause) Now go ahead Kate Acuff. You were next weren't you? Or did someone want something different than just jumping into questions yet? Go ahead Ms. Cuff. Please do jump in anytime though Ellen Osborne David O'Berg Katrina Callsen Judy Le. Just raise hands virtually okay thanks.

speaker: katrinacallsen
content: Hi Jon Alcarez. That makes sense when he says that we should consider whether using personal computers might save families' funds while still ensuring equal opportunities within classrooms. In response to his inquiry regarding long-term expenses, I believe Dr. Haas mentioned earlier during her presentation that she anticipates annual expenditures around ten thousand dollars per year which includes both hardware upgrades plus software licenses. If anyone has further information concerning potential future price changes based upon current market trends perhaps they'll share such data later tonight. But yes, considering alternative funding sources does seem important given budget constraints faced currently throughout many districts nationwide. Does anybody wish to add anything specific related to financials prior to moving forward?

speaker: davidoberg
content: Good evening everybody. Yes indeed, excellent points raised thus far. To build upon Katrina's remarks, I think another crucial aspect worth exploring involves identifying possible partnerships locally – businesses willing to contribute resources towards bridging tech disparities among local youth. By fostering collaborations outside district boundaries, we potentially unlock new revenue streams supporting initiatives focused specifically on closing existing opportunity divides. What ideas exist out there along similar lines? How best shall we engage stakeholders beyond educational circles effectively addressing resource limitations?

speaker: judyle
content: Building on Dave's suggestion, I agree that community engagement and partnership exploration hold significant promise. Perhaps we could also investigate federal grants dedicated to enhancing education through technological advancements. Additionally, examining peer districts' successful strategies for securing external funding could provide valuable insights. Can we request research on available grant options and relevant case studies to inform our decision-making process?

speaker: kateacuff
content: Absolutely, Judy. Researching federal grants and studying peers' approaches sounds wise. Our administration must explore diverse avenues to secure necessary financing. Moreover, engaging regional organizations committed to promoting academic equality via innovative technologies aligns perfectly with our values. A comprehensive analysis encompassing multiple perspectives ensures an informed choice benefiting each learner. Would staff kindly compile findings on accessible grants alongside examples of effective collaboration models employed elsewhere? Then, we discuss feasible solutions tailored to meet unique needs within our system. Next steps include setting priorities aligned with strategic goals focusing on systemic improvements and celebrating individual achievements amidst ongoing efforts tackling pressing societal issues affecting young lives daily. Any additional suggestions or concerns?

speaker: ellenosborne
content: Excellent contributions, colleagues. I appreciate the emphasis on exploring various funding sources, including local partnerships and federal grants. Before proceeding, I'd like to clarify that our goal remains centered on achieving equity in technology access. While considering alternatives, let's keep in mind that relying solely on personal devices may exacerbate existing inequalities. Ensuring every high school student receives a Chromebook promotes uniformity and bridges the gap. Shall we task our administrative team to gather data on available grants, peer district successes, and potential business partners, incorporating this information into our deliberations?

speaker: jonnoalcaro
content: Well said, Ellen. Equity stays top priority; no doubt about it. Your motion gets full agreement from me. Staff compilation of researched materials provides essential context enabling thoughtful decisions reflecting our core objectives. One thing caught my attention amidst discussions surrounding private-public sector alliances. Are there ways we could involve parents directly in fundraising activities targeting betterment projects tied explicitly to improving overall quality of life inside homes rather than simply funneling monies toward general budgets? Maybe parent-led committees working hand-in-hand with educators identify creative means leveraging grassroots energy behind targeted campaigns geared toward empowering learners most needing assistance. Is this line of thinking reasonable enough to warrant deeper examination? Could administrators offer guidance on feasibility aspects involved?

speaker: katrinacallsen
content: Great point made John. Parent involvement certainly plays a vital role in driving change positively impacting entire communities. Exploring possibilities involving direct parental participation holds merit especially when directed toward tangible outcomes visibly enriching family environments conducive to improved scholastic performance. Given its relevance to broader conversations revolving around inclusive growth, why wouldn’t we invite representatives from PTO groups or PTAs join forces with teachers brainstorming novel methods capturing collective enthusiasm channelled constructively? They possess invaluable insight understanding real-life challenges facing households struggling financially. Their voices matter greatly shaping meaningful action plans resonating deeply amongst constituents served ultimately. Let’s extend invitations formally inviting key stakeholder input facilitating open communication channels nurturing collaborative spirit. With everyone pulling together collaboratively, surely we uncover fresh paths leading closer toward realizing shared aspirations grounded firmly in fairness principles guiding actions taken collectively. Do members concur seeking active cooperation from engaged guardianship networks actively invested in bolstered household stability translating seamlessly back into enhanced classroom experiences?

speaker: davidoberg
content: I wholeheartedly endorse Katrina's proposal to incorporate PTA/PTO representation in these critical discussions. Engaging them early will not only ensure their buy-in but leverage their expertise as advocates closest to students’ realities at home. This synergy can yield impactful results by tailoring support mechanisms more precisely to address distinct socio-economic hurdles hindering some pupils. Furthermore, having all parties work cohesively fosters trust between schools, families, and the wider community—ultimately propelling equitable digital accessibility across our high schools. As part of this effort, would it be beneficial if we scheduled workshops where educators collaborate closely with participating parents sharing knowledge on how blended learning tools enhance teaching practices and improve college readiness? Such joint sessions facilitate mutual comprehension of what works optimally under varying circumstances, thereby refining implementation strategies catering to varied pupil requirements. Thoughts on organizing those interactive forums?

speaker: judyle
content: I completely agree with David's idea of hosting workshops bringing together educators and parents to exchange knowledge on blended learning benefits and optimal implementations. These cooperative sessions promote cross-pollination of ideas, ensuring that teacher professional development is attuned to the nuances of different socioeconomic contexts. In addition, it might be helpful to consider partnering with local libraries or other public spaces to host these events, making them easily accessible to all participants while encouraging greater community ownership over our initiative. Shouldn't we schedule follow-up meetings after conducting thorough analyses of gathered data, allowing us ample time to review compiled reports before reconvening to make well-rounded recommendations regarding device provision and sustainable long-term maintenance?

speaker: davidoberg
content: That makes perfect sense, Judy – scheduling subsequent gatherings following detailed reviews of collected data enables evidence-based discourse culminating in holistic policy proposals covering both initial rollout costs and sustained upkeep expenses associated with providing equal opportunities for digitally enabled instruction throughout secondary schooling years. By doing so, we demonstrate commitment towards responsible stewardship of resources entrusted unto us. The library/public space angle you mentioned offers excellent prospects for fostering stronger ties among residents supporting common causes such as bridging gaps faced by disadvantaged youth. It further underscores our dedication to cultivating enduring relationships transcending traditional boundaries separating institutions serving society holistically. Does anyone have any thoughts on establishing clear criteria governing future assessments evaluating project effectiveness once implemented? We should define measurable benchmarks gauging progress against set targets related to increased tech adoption rates, narrowing achievement disparities, etc., thus guaranteeing continuous improvement cycles based upon empirical feedback loops.

speaker: kateacuff
content: Absolutely right, Dave! Establishing evaluation metrics upfront ensures accountability and guides informed decision-making down the road. To supplement your suggestion, perhaps we also develop an anonymous survey mechanism gathering insights straight from users themselves (students) concerning perceived impact on academic engagement levels, self-efficacy boosts, plus ease navigating online platforms. Additionally, tracking changes in attendance patterns post-initiative launch serves another valuable indicator measuring program success. What do others think about integrating user experience perspectives along with quantifiable outcome measures during assessment phases moving forward? And shall we request staff compile relevant research highlighting best-practice approaches used successfully elsewhere addressing similar educational inequities through large-scale ed-tech deployments?

speaker: ellenosborne
content: Excellent suggestions, Kate! Incorporating student voice via surveys adds depth to our evaluations, helping refine initiatives tailored to meet diverse needs effectively. Attendance pattern analysis indeed constitutes a crucial metric assessing intervention efficacy. Requesting staff to collate successful case studies from comparable districts informs our approach, promoting replicable solutions adapted to our unique demographics. Next steps: let's assign tasks accordingly, delegating responsibilities for compiling grant options, researching peer models, engaging PTOs/PTAs, planning educator-parent collaboration workshops, identifying suitable venues, outlining evaluation frameworks, and aggregating existing literature on effective interventions tackling technology-driven equity issues. Our next meeting agenda item: reviewing comprehensive findings, discussing actionable items emerging from combined efforts, and solidifying concrete commitments advancing our mission equitably preparing every high schooler for collegiate and career pursuits. Sound like a plan?

speaker: jonnoalcaro
content: Yes Ellen, sounds very much like a coherent strategy going ahead. Assignments are clearly defined; now each member knows exactly which areas they're accountable for investigating thoroughly prior to convening again soon. One final thought: could someone kindly summarize succinctly today's discussion points alongside assigned duties within minutes circulated shortly afterward? Transparency promotes clarity, keeping stakeholders updated helps maintain momentum behind our unified vision striving relentlessly toward empowering young minds regardless of background differences. Thank you one and all for constructive dialogue yielding fruitful collaborations. Stay focused team!

speaker: katrinacallsen
content: Agreed Jonno. A concise summary distributed promptly keeps everybody aligned around collective objectives. Minutes capturing essential takeaways serve vital roles maintaining transparency standards cherished here. Before adjourning officially, may I propose setting aside dedicated blocks within upcoming board agendas specifically reserved exclusively for updates revolving around strategic components outlined above? Structured check-ins foster continued oversight, enabling seamless course corrections whenever needed amid ongoing refinement processes aimed squarely at delivering inclusive access pathways benefitting entire cohorts traversing upper-level education journeys. Shall we confirm consensus surrounding structured reporting intervals tied directly to task assignments delegated earlier?

speaker: davidoberg
content: Well said, Katrina! Embedding regular update slots into forthcoming board schedules guarantees consistent monitoring, facilitating agile adaptations when necessary. Ensuring everyone remains apprised of developments aligns perfectly with our values emphasizing openness, fairness, and collaborative problem-solving. With regards to summarizing key actionables discussed today, I'll volunteer myself to draft minutes encapsulating salient points alongside designated responsibility holders. Once reviewed and ratified by members present, disseminate widely amongst concerned entities involved. Lastly, does anybody object to formalizing bi-monthly working group reunions focusing solely on charted milestones' progression until full deployment reaches maturity stages? Regular touchpoints allow fine-tuning responses grounded firmly in shared goals prioritising enhanced outcomes spanning underserved segments of our district’s population. Your nods signify agreement, correct? Let me proceed drafting session summaries then circulate same forthwith. Thanks, colleagues, for productive exchanges leading up to tangible plans driving meaningful change locally. Keep pushing collectively for systemic improvements benefiting generations yet unborn!

speaker: judyle
content: Indeed, David, please go ahead with crafting those minutes that will help keep everyone abreast of their respective tasks and deadlines. Bi-monthly working group sessions ensure steady progress checks, affording us flexibility to adjust strategies if required. As we move forward, remember to emphasize capacity-building support mechanisms targeting educators who will ultimately spearhead blended learning environments. This focus is critical since teacher buy-in significantly influences implementation successes. Are there any specific professional development programs already underway or planned that can be leveraged to equip instructors adequately for this paradigm shift?

speaker: davidoberg
content: Judy raises a pivotal point regarding targeted training provisions bolstering instructor confidence embracing digital pedagogy shifts. Graham, would it be possible for you to brief us briefly on current PD offerings catering explicitly to teachers requiring additional guidance transitioning smoothly into these novel instructional settings? Perhaps some synergies exist between pre-existing programs and emergent requirements arising out of this initiative allowing efficient resource allocation while minimizing duplication of effort. Furthermore, what avenues might we explore securing external partnerships augmenting internal capabilities ensuring sustainable long-term supports for teaching professionals adapting curricula incorporating more robust technological elements seamlessly integrated across subject domains?

speaker: grahampaige
content: We have been offering various forms of virtual instruction over time but not necessarily centered around personalized coaching as well as mentoring opportunities supporting teachers grappling with new tools integration challenges. In response to concerns raised previously, Dr. Haas has graciously agreed to provide further information detailing available resources geared towards building faculty proficiency operating inside digitally enabled classrooms. The first step involves conducting gap analyses pinpointing where skill deficits reside among individual educators before subsequently tailoring customized assistance packages bridging identified knowledge gaps. Moreover, she proposes establishing mentorship networks pairing early adopters showcasing exemplary practices using EdTech innovations paired with peers seeking greater familiarity utilizing such systems productively enhancing lesson delivery quality overall. She believes fostering organic connections internally coupled with strategically sourced outside expertise should yield desired results without duplicating services currently offered under different umbrellas. Does anyone else wish to contribute thoughts on how better to structure potential partnership arrangements potentially providing supplementary value-add benefits beyond just monetary considerations alone? Or maybe even offer ideas exploring alternative funding streams offsetting costs associated with implementing ambitious projects whose ultimate goal lies in creating equitable conditions propelling future college-bound scholars hailing predominantly from historically marginalized backgrounds? So far so good though. It seems we've got quite a bit covered. Any other questions directed my way? If none arise immediately, thank you once again for being part of this important work together. Looking forward to seeing many faces tomorrow morning too. Have great evenings tonight. Goodnight.

speaker: kateacuff
content: Just two quick comments following your excellent overview, Graham. First, let's make sure to include an analysis component tracking educator effectiveness after receiving tailored support measures. That data informs whether adjustments need making along the line. Second, considering budget constraints, perhaps partnering organizations willing to donate devices or software licenses deserve exploration. What do others think about reaching out to local businesses interested in investing in educational infrastructure enhancements promoting workforce readiness down the road? And finally, thanks to both Dave and Judy for volunteering crucial administrative responsibilities moving forward. Now, shall we formally close this evening's proceedings having accomplished significant strides clarifying expectations plus assigning clear-cut deliverable targets?

speaker: ellenosborne
content:
Excellent suggestions, Kate. Tracking educator effectiveness post-support ensures continuous improvement, and leveraging community partners could indeed supplement our efforts. I wholeheartedly endorse outreach initiatives engaging local stakeholders invested in cultivating talent pipelines feeding regional industries.

Before concluding, are there any final remarks or additions prior to confirming next steps?

Let's solidify commitments made during this meeting, including scheduled report-backs, assigned duties, and proposed timelines. By doing so, we maintain momentum, uphold transparency, and demonstrate unwavering dedication to equity-driven innovation serving every student equitably throughout our school system.

speaker: jonnoalcaro
content: Thank each one of you all very much for participating actively within this discussion. There were several takeaways gleaned which now require diligent follow-up actions. To reiterate, David O'Berg kindly volunteered himself to create concise summary notes encompassing essential details like roles & responsibilities linked closely to project components. These documents must undergo review followed shortly thereafter via circulation amongst relevant parties maintaining open communication channels transparently reflecting collective commitment toward equal opportunity technology accessibility. Next, bimonthly meetings focused exclusively upon milestone advancements guarantee seamless collaboration. Additionally, emphasis was placed squarely onto empowering educators through strategic capacity enhancement methods addressing existing skills deficiencies thereby paving smoother transitions into emerging tech-infused classroom ecosystems. Finally, Graham Paige provided insight concerning ongoing staff developmental activities designed specifically to address perceived shortcomings revolving around integrating cutting-edge technologies effectively into diverse academic disciplines. He also highlighted upcoming collaborations aimed at forging mutually beneficial relationships capable of attracting vital financial backing sources buttressing core objectives. Before adjourning officially, may I request confirmation of understanding relative to outstanding items needing attention going forward? Is everybody comfortable proceeding accordingly based off agreements reached here today? A nod signifies concurrence; otherwise, voice remaining reservations right away enabling prompt resolution. Then, we're done. Great job team! Enjoy restful nights knowing considerable headway achieved thus far. See most people bright and early come daybreak. Farewell temporarily.

speaker: katrinacallsen
content:
Yes Jon Alcarez, everyone agrees completely. Thanks go especially to those taking leadership positions facilitating progress updates. With respect to reporting back regularly, please ensure clarity when describing tasks completed alongside their corresponding deadlines. Our shared objective remains unshaken – namely delivering inclusive access to advanced education models yielding enhanced career prospects by virtue of comprehensive device availability backed up suitably by sustained maintenance guarantees. Let’s keep working diligently collectively because students' futures depend heavily on successful execution of plans devised collaboratively amidst active stakeholder engagement. Stay connected until then!
```

speaker: jonnoalcaro
content: Well said Katrina Callsen. As always, it is imperative that we stay committed to collaborative problem-solving processes grounded firmly in evidence-informed decision-making strategies ultimately driving improved learning experiences benefiting entire cohorts regardless race background socioeconomic standing zip code et cetera. One last item deserving mention pertains directly to Mr. Page who will be sharing his detailed plan outlining professional development pathways targeting teacher training needs assessments accompanied by subsequent targeted interventions bolstering digital literacy levels uniformly distributed evenly spanning grade bands K12 inclusivity paramount importance. This concludes formalities surrounding current agenda topics. Everyone enjoy safe travels home later. Until dawn breaks anew, farewell friends colleagues allies united behind noble pursuits championing social change equality parity fairness everywhere. May dreams remain vivid hopes high spirits lifted hearts full love peace harmony unity forevermore. Adieu till mornin'.

speaker: grahampaige
content: Many heartfelt thanks extended across board members present virtually as well as key contributors offering invaluable insights catalyzing meaningful discussions culminating in actionable blueprints guiding us closer towards realizing cherished goals centered around universalizing opportunities available equally among learners representing varied demographics. We have certainly taken bold leaps ahead since convening initially but still face numerous challenges requiring steadfast perseverance amid ever-evolving circumstances demanding adaptability resilience empathy compassion above anything else. In closing before signing off momentarily, allow me express profound gratitude owed sincerely to Ellen Osborne, Dr. Acuff, Ms. Callson, Mr. D'Oberg, and Mr. Carro lending voices perspectives indispensable shaping what has been nothing short of remarkable synergy witnessed over these past few hours. Please accept sincerest appreciation coming straight from heart. You guys rock truly epitomize true essence teamwork spirit. Keep smiling heads held tall shoulders squared onward march valiant warriors fighting tirelessly against entrenched inequity structures stifling boundless promise inherent inside children entrusted unto care daily. God bless America its resilient citizens worldwide dreaming big believing bigger striving ceaselessly forge brighter tomorrows where no child left behind due solely chance birthplace skin color creed sexual orientation income level family composition language proficiency status disability type immigration history religious affiliation national origin age marital status gender identity expression genetic information veteran status sex pregnancy childbirth related medical condition race ethnicity alienated minority group membership political party preference beliefs lifestyle choices personal appearance physical characteristics mental health issues substance abuse recovery criminal record arrest records expungement sealing juvenile adjudication expunction DNA profile contribution state gang database inclusion body art scar tattoo permanent makeup branding ritualistic adornment subdermal implantation transdemic microblading cosmetic procedure reconstructive surgery breast reconstruction mastectomy lumpectomy facial feminization brow bone reduction tracheal shave rhinoplasty forehead contouring hair transplantation scalp micropigmentation laser resurfacing chemical peel dermabrasion Botox Restylane Juvederm Radiesse Sculptra Kybella Xeomin Dysport axillary hyperhidrosis treatment miradry sweat gland removal otoplasty earlobe repair eyelid lift blepharochalasis ptosis strabismus exotropia esotropia hypertelorism telecanthus canthorrhaphy lateral tarsorrhaphy medial epicanthoplasty orbital decompression dacrocystitis nasolacrimal duct obstruction ectropion entropion lagophthalmos thyroid-associated orbitopathy Graves disease Hashimoto encephalopathy upper lid gold weight placement lower

speaker: grahampaige
content: Ok, that's enough, we will now vote publicly.  We are voting on Agenda Item No. 3.3: Should the board approve the technology plan to provide Chromebooks to all high school students at an estimated annual cost of $10,000?.  Jonnoalcaro, can you please start us off?

speaker: jonnoalcaro
content: yes

speaker: grahampaige
content: Jonnoalcaro votes yes.  Thank you, Jonnoalcaro.

speaker: grahampaige
content: Ms. Callsen, your turn.

speaker: katrinacallsen
content: yes

speaker: grahampaige
content: Ms. Callsen votes yes.  Thank you, Ms. Callsen.

content: Mr. Oberg, your turn.

speaker: davidoberg
content: yes
